intro: Brodiaea lutea var. lugens, commonly known as the yellow brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive dry periods. It is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
